name: Spudnuts
author: Robyn
summary: This is an old family favorite, handed down for years, the outside of the doughnut is crisp and the inside is light and chewy. This does make a HUGE batch, first timers may want to half it. These are worth the effort.
ingredients: 1 cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
directions: In a small saucepan, cover peeled potatoes with water
Bring water to a boil and cook until tender, about 15 minutes
Scald the milk and add the sugar, shortening, 2 cups mashed potatoes and salt
In an upright mixer with a dough hook attachment
Add the potato mixture, flour, lemon juice, lemon zest, water, yeast eggs and nutmeg
Mix until well mixed, dough will be a bit sticky
Cover and let rise until doubled in size
Roll dough out on a lightly floured surface and cut with a doughnut cutter
Place the cut doughnuts on a greased baking sheet, cover and let rise until doubled in size
In a hot fryer or deep fry pan heat shortening or canola oil to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Carefully place 2 to 3 doughnuts in pan
Lift out when done and drain on paper towels
